intro: Achmandra zeylanica, commonly known as the Ceylon achmandra, is a flowering plant native to the wet tropical regions of Sri Lanka. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial with upright stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in dense clusters, giving it a distinctive appearance. Achmandra zeylanica is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
